ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: for you and for your livestock to enjoy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As convenience for you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: all this as provision for you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: All this was done as a means of enjoyment for you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In order to benefit you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: As provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A provision for you and for your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: an enjoyment for you and your flocks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A provision for you and for your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [all this] as a means of sustenance for you and your animals?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: A provision for you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: as a [place of] sustenance for you and your livestock.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (To be) a provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: an enjoyment for you and your herds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A source of enjoyment for you and for your animals.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As provision for you and your grazing livestock.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:33] as a [source of] sustenance (an object denoting reason for an implied [verbal clause], in other words, fa‘ala dhālika mut‘atan or tamtī‘an, ‘He did this to provide [a source of] sustenance’) for you and your flocks (an‘ām is the plural of na‘am, which are camels, cows and sheep).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A provision for you) water of benefit to you (and for your cattle) water and pasture benefit your cattle.
